meanings.sent1: The fluffy bunny had long eared ears.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's eared ears perked up when it heard its owner.
meanings.sent3: The eared ears of the cat twitched as it listened intently to the bird chirping.
meanings.sent4: The eared ears of the deer were like radars, picking up every sound in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The elephant's eared ears were a remarkable feature, allowing it to hear even the faintest of sounds.

meanings.definition: Having a specified kind or number of ears
meanings.sent1: The alien had three eared eyes on its head.
meanings.sent2: The mythical creature was described as having a hundred eared heads.
meanings.sent3: The eared monster in the story had ears all over its body, making it a great listener.
meanings.sent4: The eared statue seemed to have a thousand ears, symbolizing its ability to hear all whispers.
meanings.sent5: The eared robot had specialized ears for different frequencies, making it a master of surveillance.

meanings.definition: Having a specified kind of ear or ears
meanings.sent1: The rabbit had floppy eared ears that drooped down.
meanings.sent2: The elf had pointed eared ears that gave it a mystical appearance.
meanings.sent3: The eared pottery had unique ears shaped like tiny hands, adding a whimsical touch.
meanings.sent4: The eared door handle was designed like a human ear, giving it an eerie feel.
meanings.sent5: The eared ornament had delicate ears that added an elegant touch to the room.
